message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper deals with action recognition in videos using deep learning techniques, specifically convolutional LSTM networks. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The proposed enhancements, such as the multi-kernel extension and attention-based mechanism, involve improving the efficiency and effectiveness of the network, which could also fall under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The evaluation of the proposed enhancements is done on video datasets, which could also fall under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of LSTM networks and attention mechanisms suggests a focus on sequential data processing, which could also fall under the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
